title: Quarto Workshop
text:
The following schedule is current as of 2024-02-13.
All events will be held in the Penn State University Libraries Dewey Room.
08:30 am Coffee 09:00 am Welcome (Nicole Lazar & Rick Gilmore) 09:15 am Good enough practices for data management (Alaina Pearce) 10:15 am Break 10:30 am Policies (Briana Wham & Ana Enriquez) 11:00 am Interactive workshop 12:00 pm Lunch 12:45 pm Next steps 01:30 pm End of workshop

title: Quarto Workshop
text:
Rick Gilmore is Professor of Psychology at Penn State. He is the co-founder and co-director of the Databrary.org data library. In addition to his research on the development of vision in infants, children, and emerging adults, Gilmore is an advocate for open, transparent, reproducible, and robust research practices. He uses Quarto (and its predecessor, R Markdown) for personal and professional websites and blogs, research reports, and course materials.
rog1@psu.edu

title: Quarto Workshop
text:
Rick Gilmore is Professor of Psychology at Penn State. He is the co-founder and co-director of the Databrary.org data library. In addition to his research on the development of vision in infants, children, and emerging adults, Gilmore is an advocate for open, transparent, reproducible, and robust research practices. He uses Quarto (and its predecessor, R Markdown) for personal and professional websites and blogs, research reports, and course materials.
rog1@psu.edu

title: Magic tricks with Quarto
text:
About the workshop
This workshop focuses on the Quarto scientific and technical publishing system.
With Quarto, you can produce websites or blogs, dashboards, scientific articles, presentations, and books that combine text, figures, and code, and can be rendered into a variety of output formats. With Quarto, you can do a number of things that seem like magic tricks to scholars used to more traditional ways of working.
The workshop is open to anyone who wants to embrace more reproducible practices into their scholarly workflows.
The philosophy is “Don’t Repeat Yourself: Write it Down” or the more easily remembered “DRY WIT.”



drywit.com


Rick Gilmore, John Thomas will lead the workshop.
More details about the schedule and the faculty can be found by following the links.

title: Magic tricks with Quarto
text:
Register!
The workshop is open to all researchers, especially graduate students and postdoctoral researchers, but space is limited.






Note



We have hit the maximum number of pre-registrations we can take for the workshop.
If you wish to be added to the waiting list, please email Rick Gilmore rog1+workshop@psu.edu.





See updated information about the registrants here and here.

About
This page has links, code, and data visualizations that support the material presented in the workshop.
To reveal or hide the code, click on the button at the upper right.






Tip



Code hiding (folding) and showing is controlled by the code-fold and code-tools parameters in the YAML header for your document. See resources.qmd document to see how this is done.
